events.title: Hijrah (Migration to Medina)
events.description: The migration of Prophet Muhammad and his followers from Mecca to Medina, marking the beginning of the Islamic calendar.

events.title: Battle of Badr
events.description: First major battle in early Islamic history. Muslims achieved a decisive victory despite being outnumbered 3:1.

events.title: Battle of Uhud
events.description: Battle where Muslims learned valuable lessons about obedience to leadership. Initial success turned to setback.

events.title: Battle of the Trench (Khandaq)
events.description: Strategic battle where Salman al-Farsi suggested digging a trench, a new tactic in Arabian warfare.

events.title: Treaty of Hudaybiyyah
events.description: Peace treaty that initially seemed unfavorable but led to greater understanding and eventual conquest of Mecca.

events.title: Conquest of Mecca
events.description: Peaceful conquest of Mecca with minimal bloodshed. Idols in Kaaba were destroyed and the city was purified.

events.title: Farewell Hajj (Hajjat al-Wada)
events.description: Prophet Muhammad's final pilgrimage where he delivered his famous farewell sermon emphasizing equality and justice.

events.title: Death of Prophet Muhammad
events.description: The Prophet passed away in Medina at age 63. Abu Bakr was elected as the first Caliph.

events.title: Abu Bakr becomes First Caliph
events.description: Abu Bakr was elected as the first Caliph of Islam, uniting the community after the Prophet's death.

events.title: Umar becomes Second Caliph
events.description: Umar ibn al-Khattab became the second Caliph. Under his rule, the Islamic empire expanded significantly.

events.title: Conquest of Jerusalem
events.description: Jerusalem was peacefully surrendered to Caliph Umar. He guaranteed protection for all inhabitants.

events.title: Umar is Assassinated
events.description: Caliph Umar was assassinated by a Persian slave during prayer. Uthman was chosen as successor.

events.title: Uthman becomes Third Caliph
events.description: Uthman ibn Affan became the third Caliph. During his rule, the Quran was compiled into a standard text.

events.title: Standard Quran Compilation Completed
events.description: Under Uthman's direction, the Quran was compiled into a single standard text and copies were sent to major cities.

events.title: Uthman is Assassinated
events.description: Caliph Uthman was assassinated by rebels. Ali was chosen as the fourth Caliph, leading to the First Fitna (civil war).

events.title: Ali becomes Fourth Caliph
events.description: Ali ibn Abi Talib became the fourth Caliph. His rule was marked by civil wars (First Fitna).

events.title: Battle of the Camel
events.description: First major battle of the First Fitna between forces of Ali and Aisha, Talha, and Zubayr.

events.title: Battle of Siffin
events.description: Battle between Ali and Muawiyah I. Led to the establishment of the Umayyad Caliphate.

events.title: Ali is Assassinated
events.description: Caliph Ali was assassinated by a Kharijite during prayer in Kufa. End of the Rashidun Caliphate period.

events.title: Hasan ibn Ali becomes Caliph
events.description: Hasan ibn Ali briefly served as Caliph before abdicating to Muawiyah I, ending the First Fitna.

events.title: Umayyad Caliphate Established
events.description: Muawiyah I established the Umayyad Caliphate with its capital in Damascus.

events.title: Battle of Karbala
events.description: Hussein ibn Ali, grandson of the Prophet, was martyred at Karbala by Umayyad forces. A pivotal event in Shia Islam.

events.title: Abd al-Malik becomes Caliph
events.description: Abd al-Malik ibn Marwan became Caliph. He centralized administration and Arabicized the government.

events.title: Dome of the Rock Completed
events.description: Construction of the Dome of the Rock in Jerusalem was completed under Abd al-Malik.

events.title: Fall of the Umayyad Caliphate
events.description: The Abbasid Revolution overthrew the Umayyad Caliphate. Most Umayyad family members were killed.

events.title: Abbasid Caliphate Established
events.description: The Abbasid Caliphate was established with Abu al-Abbas as-Saffah as the first Caliph.

events.title: Baghdad Founded
events.description: Caliph Al-Mansur founded Baghdad as the new capital of the Abbasid Caliphate.

events.title: Harun al-Rashid becomes Caliph
events.description: Harun al-Rashid became Caliph. His rule is considered the peak of the Islamic Golden Age.

events.title: Bayt al-Hikmah (House of Wisdom) Established
events.description: Caliph Al-Ma'mun established the House of Wisdom in Baghdad, becoming a center of translation and research.

events.title: Al-Khwarizmi publishes Algebra
events.description: Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi published his work on algebra, founding the field.

events.title: Abbasid Caliphate Begins Decline
events.description: The Abbasid Caliphate began its decline with increasing regional independence and Turkic military influence.

events.title: Fatimid Caliphate Established
events.description: The Fatimid Caliphate was established in North Africa with Shia Ismaili doctrine.

events.title: Cairo Founded
events.description: The Fatimids founded Cairo as their capital.

events.title: Al-Azhar University Founded
events.description: Al-Azhar Mosque and University was founded in Cairo, becoming one of the oldest universities in the world.

events.title: Mamluk Sultanate Established
events.description: The Mamluk Sultanate was established in Egypt after overthrowing the Ayyubid dynasty.

events.title: Mongol Siege of Baghdad
events.description: Mongols under Hulagu Khan sacked Baghdad, ending the Abbasid Caliphate. Massive loss of knowledge and culture.

events.title: Ottoman State Founded
events.description: Osman I founded the Ottoman Beylik, which would become the Ottoman Empire.

events.title: Fall of Constantinople
events.description: Mehmed II conquered Constantinople, renaming it Istanbul. End of the Byzantine Empire.

events.title: Mughal Empire Founded
events.description: Babur founded the Mughal Empire in India after the First Battle of Panipat.

events.title: Ottoman Empire at Peak under Suleiman
events.description: Suleiman the Magnificent became Sultan. The Ottoman Empire reached its zenith.

events.title: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab Born
events.description: Birth of Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab, founder of the Wahhabi movement.

events.title: Wahhabi-Saudi Alliance
events.description: Muhammad ibn Saud and Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab formed an alliance, founding the First Saudi State.

events.title: Ottoman Caliphate Abolished
events.description: The Turkish Grand National Assembly abolished the Ottoman Caliphate. End of 1300 years of Islamic caliphate.

events.title: Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Founded
events.description: Abdulaziz Ibn Saud unified the kingdoms of Hejaz and Nejd, founding the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

events.title: Pakistan Created
events.description: Pakistan was created as the first independent Muslim state in South Asia.

events.title: State of Israel Established
events.description: The State of Israel was established, leading to the Palestinian Nakba (catastrophe).

events.title: Al-Qaeda Formed
events.description: Al-Qaeda was formed by Osama bin Laden and others.

events.title: Arab Spring Begins
events.description: The Arab Spring uprisings began in Tunisia, spreading across the Arab world.

events.title: ISIS Caliphate Declared
events.description: ISIS declared a caliphate in parts of Iraq and Syria.

events.title: Grand Mosque Expansion Completed
events.description: Major expansion of the Grand Mosque in Mecca was completed, accommodating millions more pilgrims.
